remarks: The rule ` sqrt ( z w ) = ( sqrt z ) ( sqrt w ) ` is not always true on the complex numbers, but it is true when the arguments of ` z ` and ` w ` sum to within the interval ` ( -u _pi , _pi ] ` , so there are some cases such as this one with ` z = 1 + _i A ` and ` w = 1 - _i A ` which are true unconditionally.  This result can also be stated as " ` sqrt ( 1 + z ) + sqrt ( 1 - z ) ` is analytic".  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Apr-2015.)
statement: atanlogadd $p |- ( A e. dom arctan -> ( ( log ` ( 1 + ( _i x. A ) ) ) + ( log ` ( 1 - ( _i x. A ) ) ) ) e. ran log ) $.
